title: Duke Professor Recognized for Bringing More Clarity to AI Decision Making
sub_head: Cynthia Rudin wins $1 million prize for her work on machine-learning systems that make decisions in ways people can easily understand
body:
Artificial-intelligence systems can make decisions with incredible speed and accuracy. But because they “self learn” by crunching hordes of data, it isn’t always clear how their models reach conclusions.
As these systems come to play a larger role across society, opacity in their decision-making processes has emerged as a major problem for computer scientists and practitioners.
